newsitem.title: USA: System Software sees declining Q3 expenses.
newsitem.headline: System Software sees declining Q3 expenses.

text.p: System Software Associates Inc said Thursday it expects expenses to continue to decline during its fiscal third quarter.
On Thursday, System Software reported a net loss for its second quarter ended April 30 of $0.01 versus a loss of $0.15 a share last year. Revenues rose to $98.1 million from $82.5 million.

"Expenses continued to decline, falling from the levels of the fourth quarter and falling again from the first quarter, despite a second quarter increase in revenues," Joseph Skadra, chief financial officer, said in a statement. "The firm expects that this trend will continue into the third fiscal quarter."
Skadra said cash balances at the end of the second quarter were $20.4 million, down from the previous quarter.
"SSA's third and fourth quarters are typically the strongest of the year, and typically are cash flow positive, and we expect this to be the case this fiscal year," he said.
